titles.title: A concurrent resolution establishing the Joint Congressional Committee on Inaugural Ceremonies.

vote.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mrs. Davis (CA) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. Con. Res. 67.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/28/2008--Passed House without amendment. Establishes a Joint Congressional Committee on Inaugural Ceremonies to make the necessary arrangements for the inauguration of the President-elect and the Vice President-elect of the United States.
